Articles.Content:
It is common knowledge that quite a few kerbal space program players don't have very good computers. Yet many of these players can build great things that they want to show off. This is why I have decided to start offering recording crafts for players who want to show off the craft, even if they don't have a computer good enough to do so. Videos are recorded in full 1080p at 60 fps on high quality settings. All you have to do is post a download link for your craft file (or just a link to a forum post to it), and sit back. Although please make sure to tell me how you want it recorded and any other special requests. When finished I can either PM you a download link, or post it to my youtube account and send you the link. Your choice.

Edited November 19, 2013 by Superfish57
Sounds like a wonderful service! I often have that trouble when I try to show my creations. What kind of maximum craft are you able to film (200-300 parts, or Whackjob-style)?

I am going to have to test that. Although I imagine I should be able to get around 300 to 400 parts. I will update later.

EDIT: After testing I found that I can get around 300-370 parts at a good frame rate. For Wackjob style things I can speed up the video if there is constant lag.

Edited November 19, 2013 by Superfish57
Did some testing

Ok, if noone else is willing to be the first, i'll bite.

This is my go-anywhere-and-come-back ship, capable of a landing anywhere in system.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/cxlh1qx40ak8hz2/Herald%20V.craft

and here's the same one after all the 'launch stuff' has been expended:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/cgbve8fmm8zrwrl/Herald%20V_IP.craft

Note that you will need the Cirrus envelope from Hooligan airship mod to load fully.

If you don't have that mod/do not wish to install the parts, i'll include a 'pluginless' part to download here:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/5fn9ijyojiibxp7/HooliganLabs.zip

Basically, the launch stage, obviously on the ground and for a little while after launch, the IP stage in orbit around, say, Laythe or Duna, with the little Kerbal returning home in the central ion pod stage.

Feel free to host it on your Youtube, just please acknowledge me
I am curious what kind of computer drives this

I am curious what kind of computer drives this

It's name is Data and it was created by Doctor Noonien Soong.

Oh god all the replies! Time to answer some questions.

Fitzy3:

Yep, just don't have too many mods please.

Camcha:

Computer specs: Sandy bridge i5-3450 OC'd to 3.8 ghz, 1gb NIVIDA GeForce GTX 650 gpu, 8 gigs of ram, and recording with NIVIDA shadowplay.

kahlzun:

I'll get to recording today.
